New Yorkers are bracing for an immigration crackdown amid significant weather changes and increased traffic delays, while the city grapples with pressing social issues, including a recent tragic incident involving an abandoned infant and ongoing debates over housing policies and public safety.

### Risks & Alerts

- New Yorkers prepare for potential immigration crackdown, raising concerns among local communities. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiogFBVV95cUxPQWFQRHhHMG1uOVlKT3JxRnk2clFOYWZlNk5VYjVOR0xjOVEwWTkxWUFLc091bFR2RVo0VWp0b2pZSkhwWThzaDBDcG8tUFlkNTh3R015d1c5eWpDaUVHeENnYTFlX05nS3lhcVdlOG5tX2Fla2p0d19UVlNGckEwSnBEY3lHYUQ1aWdrWDY0TVRnTUw3SDVqX2NDUnJENkZnZmc?oc=5)
- Expect 30-minute delays at N.J. tunnels affecting traffic into New York. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Significant weather pattern changes expected as Thanksgiving approaches, impacting travel plans. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
